section.title: Elver Persistency has moved to Eclipse.org as Teneo within EMFT

p.strong: Elver persistency has moved to eclipse.org as the Teneo project within EMFT:

ul.li: The elver.org website will remain the source for documentation of Teneo.
The source code can be retrieved from Eclipse cvs. The new main java package name is now: org.eclipse.emf.teneo.jpox

Teneo/Elver is part of the EMFT build process, builds can be downloaded here: EMFT Downloads (select the Teneo project in the listbox). For the Eclipse update manager use: http://download.eclipse.org/technology/emft/updates/site-interim.xml.
Support is given on the EMFT newsgroup: news://news.eclipse.org/eclipse.technology.emft.

section.title: EMF Persistency Solution using JDO/JPOX
section.p: The EMF - JPOX integration supports all EMF and JDO 2.0/JPOX features. EMF objects can be persisted in most major relational databases and retrieved using an EMF resource approach or advanced JDOQL queries.

p.strong: Current version (Teneo): 0.7.5 BETA for Eclipse 3.2/EMF 2.2/JPOX 1.1.1 and jdk 1.4 and later, Status, Features, Change Log
Releases are not guaranteed to be backward compatible. Before upgrading first read the Change Log and Upgrading pages.

p.em: For troubleshooting please visit the Known Issues and Troubleshooting pages.

section.title: JPOX
section.p: The EMF - JDO/JPOX integration is a layer over the JPOX 1.1.0 (JDO 2.0) product. JPOX is the reference implementation for JDO 2.0. The jpox website has excellent documentation. Please visit JPOX at http://www.jpox.org.

section.title: EMF
section.p: The Eclipse Modeling Framwork (EMF) is a modeling and code generation framework which generates source code from different sources: an UML diagram or a XML Schema. For more information see here.
